p: Airway epithelial cells are the primary target for HMPV replication [ 96, 101]. Similar to RSV, human alveolar epithelial (A549) cells are also susceptible to HMPV infection [ 96, 102]. Experimental evidence indicates that HMPV infection of A549 cells induces the expression of RIG-I and MDA5, but only uses the RIG-I signaling pathway to initiate the expression of IFN-β [ 87]. Further studies demonstrate that infection of A549 cells with HMPV induces the production of both IFN-α and IFN–β in a time-dependent manner, but higher amounts of IFN-β than IFN-α was produced in this model [ 96]. More recently, we observed that HMPV is also able to induce the expression of IFN-λ1-4 in A549 cells, and in higher levels than those of IFN-β [ 57].
